alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Juneau (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 4:25AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...MENDENHALL RIVER HAS CRESTED... THE MENDENHALL RIVER AND LAKE HAVE CRESTED AND WATER LEVELS HAVE BEGUN TO DROP. AS OF 415 AM MONDAY MORNING, THE MENDENHALL LAKE GAGE WAS AT 6.95 FEET AND DIMINISHING. A CREST HEIGHT OF 7.7 FEET WAS OBSERVED AT 1 AM AKDT MONDAY, AUGUST 21. THIS IS BELOW THE FLOOD STAGE OF 9.0 FEET. WATER LEVELS IN THE BASIN AT THE BEGINNING OF THE CURRENT RELEASE WERE ESTIMATED TO BE ABOUT A QUARTER AS HIGH AS WHAT WAS OBSERVED AT THE START OF THE PRIMARY RELEASE EARLIER THIS MONTH. WE DO NOT KNOW IF ALL THE WATER IN THE BASIN WILL RELEASE, NOR EXACTLY HOW MUCH WATER REMAINS IN THE BASIN. CONSEQUENTLY, THE EXACT TIMING AND SPEED OF THE DROP IN WATER LEVEL MAY VARY FROM THE FORECAST. THE RIVER WILL CONTINUE TO BE MONITORED, IN THE EVENT THAT MORE WATER RELEASES FROM THE BASIN.
